text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies! Today, we’re gonna be making

something very special for Starcraft 2, Heart
of the Swarm!
HOTS!

For the first time ever, we are gonna be making
3 cupcakes from scratch, different

recipes to represent each of the minerals
of Starcraft.

Because without your minerals, you got no
game!

Minerals are very important, they make the
money honey!

We are gonna be making 3 different types of
cupcakes today, the first is

gonna be a made from scratch lemon cupcake
to represent the gold minerals.

Then we are gonna be making a blueberry cupcake
to represent the blue minerals,

And then last but not least we are gonna be
making a mint chocolate chip yummy,

yummy, yummy! Cupcake which will be representing
the Vespian Gas!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need for the lemon cupcakes
will be: 3/4 cup of butter,

6 eggs, 1 tablespoon of grated lemon zest,
so you will also need a lemon zester,

1/4 cup of lemon juice, 3/4 cup of cream cheese,
1-1/2 cups of sugar, just regular

sugar, 2-1/4 cups of flour, 1-1/2 teaspoons
of baking powder,
and 1/2 a teaspoon of salt.

We are gonna start off by mixing our butter
and 1-1/4 cups of sugar into a large

mixing bowl, beat the mixture on medium speed
until it’s light and fluffy.

Now, add the eggs and 3 tablespoons of lemon
juice. Beat until it’s well combined,
scraping down the bowl once or twice as necessary.

Then, mix in the flour, baking powder, salt
and 2 teaspoons of lemon zest,

until everything is combined. These are my
favorite lemon cupcakes because of

what we’re gonna do right now. In a small
bowl, mash together cream cheese,

the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, the remaining
1 tablespoon of lemon juice and

the remaining 1 teaspoon of lemon zest, until
everything is combined.

Now scoop 2 tablespoons of the normal batter
into each cupcake liner, then

scoop 1 tablespoon of the yummy cream cheese
filling on top of the batter,

then finally, add 1 more scoop of the normal
batter, 4 tablespoons in total.

Now these lemon cupcakes are all ready to
bake, you’re gonna pre-heat your oven to

350 and bake for about 20 minutes, these are
seriously the best lemon cupcakes

I have ever had. Because when you bite into
them, you get that creamy,

cream cheese zesty lemon freshness, it is
so good!

I will put all the recipes down below so that
you can check them out.

Now we’ve gotta get our blueberry cupcakes
going, for the blue minerals!

The ingredients you’ll need for the blueberry
cupcakes will be: 2 teaspoons of

vanilla extract, 2 sticks of butter, which
also equals 1 cup of butter,

4 large eggs, 1-1/2 cups of fresh blueberries, 2
cups of sugar, 1-3/4 cup of cake flour,

1-1/4 cup of unbleached flour, 1 tablespoon
of baking powder, 3/4 teaspoon of salt,
and 1 cup of whole milk!

To start off, combined all of the flours,
sugar, baking powder and salt into

a big mixing bowl, mix on a low speed until
combined. Once combined, add your
butter and then mix again.

In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk
and vanilla.

Now, with your mixer on medium speed, add
the wet ingredients in 3 parts.

Also be sure to scrape down the sides of the
bowl, and beat the batter until

the ingredients are thoroughly combined. In
another bowl, gently toss your

fresh blueberries with a little bit of flour,
and then carefully add them
into the mixture of batter.

Using a tablespoon, scoop the batter into
the little cupcake liners,
filling them about 2/3 full.

Once your blueberry cupcakes are ready for
the blue minerals, you’re gonna put
them in the oven at 325 for 20 minutes.

And now onto the Vespian Gas cupcakes, the
mint chocolate chip cupcakes,
my favorite!

The ingredients you’ll need for the mint
chocolate chip cupcakes will be:

1 tablespoon of vanilla, 6 tablespoons of
butter, 1 large egg, 1/4 cup

of sour cream, 1/2 a cup of cocoa powder,
3/4 cup of brown sugar,

1/3 cup of regular sugar, 1/2 a cup of flour,
3/4 tablespoon of baking soda,

1/4 tablespoon of salt, and 1/2 a cup of whole
milk.

Mix together the butter and sugar until everything
is light and fluffy!

Beat in the egg and vanilla. Whisk together
the whole milk and sour cream

and then set aside. Now, mix together the flour,
chocolate cocoa, baking soda

and salt. Now you’re gonna add the whole
milk mixture, alternating with
the dry ingredients, about a 1/2 at a time.

Using a tablespoon, spoon the batter into
the paper lined pans.

Now we’re gonna put these chocolate cupcakes
in the oven, bake at 350

for 20 minutes. While the cupcakes are baking,
we’re gonna make these little

candy gas geysers out of chocolate melts,
I’ve just got a bowl full of chocolate melts here.
If you don't have chocolate melts, you can use Hershey kisses!

And, I’ve got this little mold, they’re
so cute! They look like Gas geysers,
check that out! Yeah!

So what we’re gonna do is melt the chocolate,
and then we’re gonna fill

2 tall, all the way to the top, and the 1
about 1/2 way, because on the minerals,

2 of geysers are tall, and 1 is kinda
short.

Melted the chocolate, snip the tip, it’s
gonna get a little messy, that’s OK!

To make the blue and gold minerals, we are
going to be using yellow and blue

Jolly Ranchers! And remember, for the yellow
Jolly Ranchers, you will

need to buy the wild berry mix, not the regular
bag of Jolly Ranchers,
but the wild berry!

I’ve got my safety glasses on because I
need ‘em!

You put them in a big plastic plastic bag
and beat ‘em with a hammer.
To get that really crystal, mineral look.

Now that our cupcakes are all done, we’ve
got your lemon cupcakes, our blueberry

cupcakes and our chocolate cupcakes, we are
going to frost them!

This is a cream cheese frosting, I’ll put
a link down below to the recipe that

I used, it is so good! And then when
you get to the chocolate cupcakes,

you’re just going to add a little bit of
peppermint, so that they will be a
mint chocolate chip cupcake, yum, yum, yum!

But for these 2, the lemon and the blueberry,
you’re just gonna use cream

cheese frosting. And I added a little bit of
food coloring dye, to make it

green, so it looks like grass, like the map,
it’s gonna look so good!

The tip that I’m using has multiple, if
you’ll look right there, has

multiple little holes, so that when you squeeze
the frosting out, it’s gonna
look like grass, it’s pretty cool!

Now that the cupcakes are frosted, looking
like little grass!

We’re gonna put the gas geysers on top!
This is what they look like when

they come out of the freezer, so cute! So
I’m just gonna put the little one right in front,
and then two taller ones!

Now for the final touch on the gas geysers,
you’re gonna take the frosting

and I’ve added a regular circle tip to the
front, and remember this is the

cream cheese, peppermint frosting
for the Mint Chocolate Chip ones!

And you’re just gonna put a little bit on
the top!
Oh they look so cool!

Now we’re gonna put our Jolly Ranchers on
the other Cupcakes!

Ta-da! Our Starcraft Mineral Cupcakes are
all done!

I hope you guys like ‘em and I hope I didn’t
mess up too bad and they look
like a HOTS mess! HOTS, ah-ah-ah! Get it?

All joking aside, I’m really excited for
the game to come out, and we made

3 awesome cupcakes today, we made the, from
scratch! Lemon cupcake with the

lemon Jolly Ranchers on top for the gold minerals,
we made the blueberry cupcake

with the blue raspberry Jolly Ranchers on
top for the blue minerals, and for

the Vespian Gas Geysers we made chocolate cupcakes
with mint chocolate chip frosting,

yum, yum, yum! From cream cheese, and little
chocolate geysers!

If you have any other suggestions for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make them happen.
OK, bye-bye!
